Comment.Content:
Woohoo!
We are currently thinking about switching completely to PartCover (from NCover), therefore this is a very useful post for us.
Thanks a lot for sharing.
Happy testing Urs
Comment.TargetTitle: PartCover.Net and CC.Net Part 2 - Making it pretty.
Comment.Author: Urs Enzler - NMock2 dev team

Comment.Content: Great stylesheets. I just switched from NCover to PartCover and they came in handy. Had to make a bugfix to the assembly report; line 37 seems to be missing a "0" after ">".
Comment.TargetTitle: PartCover.Net and CC.Net Part 2 - Making it pretty.
Comment.Author: Dan Ports

Comment.Content: Is it possible to get the coverage by namespace. I have a single dll which has multiple modules with different namespaces. I need to see the code coverage for every modules available in the single assembly.
Comment.TargetTitle: PartCover.Net and CC.Net Part 2 - Making it pretty.
Comment.Author: vishal

Comment.Content: @Vishal: I guess is possible to do so. You should play with the stylesheet a little bit, but I don't see why not. I will try to post something about this later on.

Comment.Content: Thanks for the XSL... got an issue with the assembly one, but worked well once I replaced <xsl:if test="$codeSize &gt;"> by <xsl:if test="$codeSize &gt; 0">
